channel.title: Online Advertising on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Online Advertising on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Nothing But Net (And Ads)
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: People want an improbable deal, no matter how unlikely that deal might actually be. Hence the strong interest in MoviePass, a company with a model so doomed that people were suggesting it would initially fail not long after it started offering free daily tickets at $9.99 per month. (Instead, its fast decline took about a year, even with a high burn rate, and now the company is changing its model because it has no other choice.

item.title: The Taboola of the 1930s
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: When I see people complaining about the images and links shared through the “content discovery” platform Taboola and its cousin Outbrain—something I admittedly have been known to do—I inevitably find myself drawn to the “taboo” part of the Israeli company’s name. Because, if you think about it, it’s a really good descriptor of the images you see adding noise to nearly every large site on the internet.
